newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nikko Sec can't confirm report on racketeer deals.
newsitem.headline: Nikko Sec can't confirm report on racketeer deals.

text.p: Nikko Securities Co Ltd said on Tuesday it could not confirm a newspaper report that it may have done illegal deals for a "sokaiya" racketeer who is a key figure in a high-profile payoff scandal.

The Japanese daily Sankei Shimbun said on Tuesday that racketeer Ryuichi Koike had an account at Nikko which it said was suspected of violating securities and commercial laws by conducting illegal transactions for Koike.
Tokyo prosecutors will soon begin investigating Nikko and two other big securities houses, Daiwa Securities Co Ltd and Yamaichi Securities Co Ltd, for possible deals for Koike, the paper said.
"We have not confirmed anything reported in the article," a Nikko spokesman said.
On Monday, Tokyo prosecutors indicted a former chairman of Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank Ltd (DKB) on suspicion of making illegal loans to Koike.
